definition[0]: to let liquid come out of your mouth onto your face
example[0]: Watch out, the baby is dribbling on your shirt!
example[1]: He was dribbling tea onto his tie.
definition[1]: if a liquid dribbles somewhere, it flows in a thin irregular stream
example[2]: Blood from the wound dribbled down the side of his face.
definition[2]: to move the ball along with you by short kicks, bounces, or hits in a game of football, basketball etc
example[3]: He was trying to dribble the ball past his opponents.
definition[3]: if something such as money or news dribbles somewhere, it comes or goes in small irregular amounts
example[4]: Money is finally dribbling back into the country now.
definition[4]: to pour something out slowly in an irregular way
example[5]: Dribble a few drops of olive oil over the pizza.
definition[5]: a small amount of liquid that has come out of your mouth
example[6]: He wiped the dribble from his chin.
definition[6]: the act of moving the ball along with you by short kicks, bounces or hits in a game of football, basketball etc
